data.title: Average Buffet and Dinner....
data.text: Stopped with a co-worker while we were in town on business.  Had the buffet and it was average at best.  The selections were not bad, although I have had better at other places.  The price I thought was reasonable for what we got.

owner_response.author: Anthony C, Guest Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review, Bruce.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ashley johns awesome
data.text: My server was the best I can say been here lots in she was the best server I will say you need to ask for her as I will every time we go in thank you

owner_response.author: Anthony C, Guest Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the five star review Charles. We will definitely the good words to Ashley. We are glad to know she exudes that southern customer service we pride ourselves on. We look forward to having you come back to visit us soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: This is what I like about the South
data.text: I ran into the Cattleman's Buffet for lunch and was pleased to find all those southern dishes one would expect to find in Louisana. Fried catfich, crawfish, sweet potatoes and collard greens. That's what I call a hungry mans lunch. All the food was seasoned just right and delicious. LPS

owner_response.author: Stephanie D, Guest Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi there, 

Thanks so much for taking the time to review your stay with us. We're glad you enjoyed the southern dishes! We're glad you found it all seasoned perfectly, and we hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Cattlemen Buffet
data.text: Worst buffet I've ever eaten at. I'm being generous to say the food was mediocre and the service non-existent

owner_response.author: JustinBpnk, Public Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your recent visit to Cattlemen's Buffet and for your review. We're sorry to see your last visit wasn't completely perfect. It is our goal to serve the best food of any casino buffet in the region and your feedback will help us realize this goal. We would like to invite you to send us your contact information to socialmedia@boomtownbossier.com and provide us with additional information regarding your visit. Again, we apologize for your experience and look forward to showing you just how great our buffet can be.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Entrees good but not supported
data.text: The unlimited crab legs were why we ate there at 6:30 pm. All the entrees we tried were good but all the sides had been out too long and many were almost empty. Entrees were replenished but the other food just dwindled down further. We had to request crackers for the salad and the ranch dressing was empty the entire visit.

data.title: Overpriced
data.text: For the price you pay you'd expect the food to be top notch.  The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything to get excited over.  For the quality of food the buffet should be half the price of what you pay.

data.title: Unexpected price increase!
data.text:
First, let me say thank you to Boomtown Casino for honoring us veterans with a free buffet on Veterans Day!  
Now for the not so good....Price on their website states the nighttime buffet price Sun-Thurs is $14.95.  However, they charged $23.95 because they added shrimp and crab legs.  Nowhere did it say they were going to do this on their website.  In addition, the price is more than what they charge on Fri and Sat nights.
The buffet in our opinion was good for the free portion, but not the price they charged. 
We don't plan on going back as we like Horseshoe and Sam's Town buffets much better. More selection, fresher food.
Again, thank you for offering the free buffet to us veterans.

owner_response.author: JustinBpnk, Public Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your recent visit to Cattlemen's and for your review. We're sorry to see your last visit wasn't completely perfect at The Buffet. It is our goal to serve the best food of any casino buffet in the region and your feedback will help us realize this goal. Again, we apologize for your experience and we look forward to seeing you again soon and showing you just how great our buffet can be.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: EVERYTHING  TASTED LIKE FISH
data.text:
We were here on Nov 7 20015 about 8:00 PM
It is a never know with this location seems one time the food is good and the next time it is as if they have never cooked before 
 My wife will eat just about any food she puts on her plate even if she does not like it and she has a wide range of foods she will eat. I am not that way so I I always get a small amount of something and very picky about what I eat
 Fish is not one of her or my dishes. I will eat some fish but more fried shrimp and frog legs for me in the fish dept.
 Our first round for me was fried shrimp a couple of small pieces of fish , fries and black eye peas and she had roast, a stew ,green beans black eye peas and another side
 I mentioned the peas had a taste like fish , she stated yes ,they do that is odd and she would not eat them .It was a very strong taste. I then mentioned that the fish really had strong fish taste as well and could not eat them(I had three small pieces got 1 1/2 down)
 I then go back for more shrimp and get corn on the cob and red baked potato . The wife went back and got fried chicken and a red baked potato 
 As soon as she took a bite of the chicken she says I am done with that. I take a bite of the corn on the cob and then the potato and same thing it has such a strong fish taste, I could eat neither
 We were really surprised that everything had a fish taste.
 We started to wonder if they boiled the crab and other fish and then used the same water to cook everything in and used the same grease from the fried fish and shrimp to cook the chicken
 It did not seem to matter what we ate it had a strong fish taste
 Even being seafood I still can't see paying 21 to 26.00 for a meal
 _____________PROS _________________
 It was free
 it was convenient
 shrimp was really good 
___________________CONS______________
Way overpriced if buying
very little that had a good taste
No silverware had to wait until they could wash some
 Long wait time to get seated

data.title: A Pretty Average Casino Buffet
data.text:
In recent months, The International Buffet at Sam's Town Casino
in Shreveport stopped serving lunch Mon. - Thurs. and forced me
to find another buffet to chow down at during my casino trips to
Shreveport/Bossier City.  There are several buffets that are really
good if you're willing to shell out big bucks for a meal - which I'm
not willing to do.  So, for the last several trips, I settled on the
Cattleman's Buffet at the Boomtown Casino which is a good 
(not great) buffet at a reasonable price.  The main problem I 
have with Boomtown's buffet though, is that it closes their lunch
meal when I prefer to eat.  They're only open for three hours
(11:00 am - 2:00 pm) so I have to psych myself into eating 
extra early (for me it's early) before finding my way into the
casino.  I've always enjoyed eating and playing at Sam's Town
more than at Boomtown, but I guess their cutting back had to
do with money - it usually is!

The Cattleman's is a pretty much average buffet, but nicely
designed and laid-out in several sectioned-off areas with pastel
colors, and a comfortable and inviting atmosphere.  On my last
several visits, the service staff has been excellent - very friendly,
helpful, and accommodating.  If you use your My Choice Card 
at lunch (Sun. - Sat.), the buffet is a very reasonable $9.95, and
you can usually get a buy one - get one meal by pulling the free
pull machine as you enter the casino (or at least that has been 
my experience).  On Friday and Saturday nights, their seafood
dinner buffet is $21.95 - much more that I prefer to pay for a 
meal.

The food selection, while limited compared to other casino 
buffets has, for the most part, been good to average.  At the
carving station, on my latest visit, they had a fantastic roast
beef that was lean, tender, and tremendously flavorful.  I really
love good catfish, but their offering was only average at best,
and their hushpuppies tasted left-over or straight out of a fro-
zen food bag.  The salads, on the other hand, were good, as
were the desserts.  The soup (vegetable) and the gumbo were
both very good.

The Cattleman's Buffet, as I've stated, is pretty average as far
as casino buffets go, but for the price it isn't bad at all.

owner_response.author: JustinBpnk, Public Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review us. We are thrilled to see your overall experience was great. We appreciate all of the comments and we look forward to having you as a guest again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Awful!!!
data.text: We went to eat 6/24/2015, there were so many flies we were having to keep them off of our food.  We took turns going to buffet so the other person would watch our plate to keep flies off of it. Lettuce at salad bar had 3-4 flies crawling in it, I couldn't eat there!!  They gave us a hard time getting our money back, we still ended up $10 dollars short. Have tried to call repeat times, get sent to voices mail.  They are very unprofessional and the facility is nasty!!!  They should be ashamed of themselfs.

owner_response.author: ExcellenceMgr, Guest Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for letting us know about your experience. We assure you our guest safety and health is of the upmost concern of ours. We apologize you did not receive a return call. Please feel free to contact our Operational Excellence Manager at 318.841.2169 to discuss your experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Terrible food
data.text: Walking into the buffet the odor of old food is overwhelming especially an old seafood type smell!  This used to be a 5 star buffet but clearly they are not taking care of business!

owner_response.author: ExcellenceMgr, Guest Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We apologize you did not have a pleasant dining experience. We would like to discuss it further. Please call our Operational Excellence Manager at 318.841.2169.  We hope we hear from you soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: something has changed
data.text:
We have been back to this buffet a couple of times since my last review 
We were here on 9 may 2015 for the evening (dinner/supper) buffet
 It was mostly fish or fish related very little to pick from if not a fish person
 I have decided this location has purchased stock in a seasoning company as they pour the seasoning on the food
 Some people would like to taste the meat and not be breathing fire when you take a bite of something
 I am not a person of spicy foods and saw a lot of food go to waste and I think the reason is the food is over spiced/seasoned
 MY wife will eat anything or try she does not believe in waste but even some items she could not eat 
 The ribs were pure spices/seasoning and way over cooked 
 The fried fish was hit and miss one piece was so spicy and seasoned I could not eat it and the next piece had nothing it was as if it was mixed
 The last couple of times we have been here , lunch or supper it has gone downhill
 They have a sign up gizzards and another sign up livers ( chicken) to me that means they are in a separate container .They are not they are mixed together why have two separate signs in two different spots and two different containers  if you are going to mix them 
I have to say the frog legs and the fried shrimp were great  and did fill up on those
 Really  think someone actually needs to walk around and look at the waste and try to find out why 
 I know some people just like to waste because they think they have the right but a lot of people waste because they can't eat for the spices that are put on
 My wife does not eat fish or fish products she was only able to select soft fried chicken ) Not Crispy )or the spiced up overcooked ribs 
 Now if you are into crab legs and boiled crayfish then this is a place to be and for the price it is on target. I say this with the understanding I do not eat either and am only going  by price and what they are . They could be over seasoned as well
 Wish they had some fried  tails would love to try them
 When you pay roughly 22 to 25 bucks for a meal there should be more than two meat items of non fish
 Very disappointed in the last couple of visits

data.title: Weekend brunch was just awful!!
data.text:
I am usually very tolerant of buffets and rarely give bad reviews because generally there is always something that you can find to eat but in all honesty this would have to rate as one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a buffet.!
The only thing that was barely edible was the toast and I say barely edible because the actual toaster machine looked like it have never been cleaned and it was difficult to choke down the bread and not think about the fact it had been sitting in filth.
The bacon was oily, greasy and was the fattiest cut of bacon I have ever seen. The french toast had soaked too long so while it looked like it was cooked the bread in the middle was still soaked in raw egg mixture. The pancakes and waffles could have been used as frisbees, both were rock hard and stale...completely inedible. I gave up trying to eat any breakfast food and moved on to dessert, I tried a chocolate cake which was Stale!! It was only 9am in the morning and already they were serving stale chocolate cake, I hate to see what the dinner diners will get. Again this was the worst buffet I have ever had and I will never go again.

owner_response.author: ExcellenceMgr, Guest Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback.  We have passed your comment to the Executive Chef so he may correct the issues.  Thank you again for taking the time to leave a review.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: GREAT!!!!!!
data.text: If you go to Bossier City you got to eat at this buffet it has eveything you can ask for on the bar and also all you cna eat crab leggs the only problem I had was the server not being on top of her game for refills on drinks but overall to me and my family was the best

owner_response.author: ExcellenceMgr, Guest Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are happy to hear you enjoyed your meal.  Thank you passing on the comments about the service.  We use this during training to improve the experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Buffet at Boomtown
data.text: I am not a seafood fan, but my friend raved about this place, so I figured I'd give it a try.  It was delicious!  Everything was seasoned well and there was plenty to go around.  For anyone who loves seafood, this is the place! HUGE crab legs and a large variety of not only seafood, but other dishes as well including beef tips and rice, plus plenty of classic Louisiana dishes.  And the peach cobbler was DELICIOUS!

owner_response.author: ExcellenceMgr, Guest Relations Manager at Cattleman's Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are overjoyed to hear you enjoyed dining with us at Cattlemen's Buffet. We hope you make another trip soon to see us!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great steaks
data.text: This is a good place to eat a steak and relax over a fine dining experience. Will visit them again in the future
